definition: robber/plunderer/predator
to take over by force/to rob/to plunder/to brush over/to skim/to sweep
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Thanks to demonization of Hinduism by British lootersand their evangelists.
sentences.chinese: 感謝英國掠奪者及其佈道者對印度教的妖魔化。

sentences.english: These camp robbers hae become habituated to campers as a food source.
sentences.chinese: 這些營地掠奪者已經慣於將野營者作爲一種食物來源。

sentences.english: That particular screenshot mentioned shows off a visceral fight between Marauders and Immortals.
sentences.chinese: 這張截屏展示了掠奪者和不朽者的激烈戰鬥。

sentences.english: Today, many Burmese view China as a pillager of resources.
sentences.chinese: 如今，許多緬族人都把中國看做是一個資源掠奪者。

sentences.english: I'll go into some of the Marauder mechanics.
sentences.chinese: 我會談下掠奪者的結構。

sentences.english: Faced with a precipice or a predator, the brain is biased to make certain decisions.
sentences.chinese: 面對懸崖或掠奪者，大腦做出的決定會有一定的不同。

sentences.english: The Razorfang Ravager can now be tamed.
sentences.chinese: 剃牙掠奪者現在可以被馴服。

sentences.english: Centaurs – marauders does not have penalty when shooting into support.
sentences.chinese: 半人馬掠奪者在近身攻擊時不受傷害懲罰。

sentences.english: The wingspan of an MQ1 Predator A model is 55ft.
sentences.chinese: MQ1掠奪者A型的翼展爲55英尺。

sentences.english: The looters behaved as if altogether bereft of their senses.
sentences.chinese: 掠奪者表現得似乎全都喪失了理智。

sentences.english: To Romanians Russia is a predator .
sentences.chinese: 而對羅馬尼亞人而言，俄國人則是掠奪者。

sentences.english: This and the Marauder are my new favorite Terran units.
sentences.chinese: 維金以及掠奪者是我最喜歡的人族單位。

sentences.english: Shred lightning and rayl, the bear is a taker.
sentences.chinese: 如碎裂的閃電和轟雷一聲，巨熊顯然是個掠奪者。

sentences.english: Mr. Bolloré is France's top corporate raider .
sentences.chinese: 博洛雷先生是法國頂尖的企業掠奪者。

sentences.english: Slowly the wasters and despoilers are impoverishing our land.
sentences.chinese: 浪費者和掠奪者們在慢慢地糟蹋着我們的土地。

sentences.english: Corporate raiders often raise money by creating funds in the form of partnerships.
sentences.chinese: 企業掠奪者們通常以合夥的形式籌集資金。

definition: to whisper to one another's ear
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
masquerade
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to return something to its rightful owner
doddering/senile
condor/bald eagle
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to feel helpless/feeling useless
a short time/a little while
to withdraw/to hole up
a gleam of hope
mushroom cloud
fiends (idiom); devils and monsters
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
